info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 27 at 8:32PM CDT until June 2 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...
Black Cypress Bayou At Jefferson affecting Marion and Cass Counties.
For the Black Cypress Bayou...including Jefferson...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Black Cypress Bayou at Jefferson.
* WHEN...From late Saturday night to Monday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Lowland flooding will affect mainly timber resources.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 9.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.0 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.6 feet on 12/23/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: https://water.noaa.gov/wfo/SHV
The next statement will be issued Wednesday evening at 845 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT TO MONDAY MORNING
